com.complexible.common.memory

Interface MemoryPool

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable

    public interface MemoryPool
extends Disposable

    A pool of memory from which allocations can occur.

    Since:
    2.1
    Version:
    2.1
    Author:
    Michael Grove

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long calloc(long theSize)
      Allocate memory from this pool and zero it
      boolean canAllocate(long theSize)
      Returns whether or not the pool can perform an allocation of the given size.
      void dispose()
      Clean up this memory pool.
      boolean free(long theAddress)
      Return the memory at the given address to the pool
      boolean isEmpty()
      Return whether or not there is any memory left in this pool.
      long malloc(long theSize)
      Allocate memory from this pool.
      long memLeft()
      Return how many bytes remain in this pool
      long size()
      Return the total size of the memory pool
      MemoryPool slice(long theSize)
      Create a child pool of the given size.

    • Method Detail

      • dispose

        void dispose()
        Clean up this memory pool. This will automatically free all memory allocated by this pool which has not already been released as well as disposing of all child pools.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface Disposable

      • malloc

        long malloc(long theSize)
        Allocate memory from this pool.
        Parameters:
        theSize - the amount of memory to allocate
        Returns:
        the address of the allocated memory
        Throws:
        NotEnoughMemoryException - if the pool does not have enough memory to complete the allocation

      • calloc

        long calloc(long theSize)
        Allocate memory from this pool and zero it
        Parameters:
        theSize - the amount of memory to allocate
        Returns:
        the address of the allocated, zeroed memory
        Throws:
        NotEnoughMemoryException - if the pool does not have enough memory to complete the allocation

      • free

        boolean free(long theAddress)
        Return the memory at the given address to the pool
        Parameters:
        theAddress - the address
        Returns:
        true if the memory was freed, false otherwise

      • canAllocate

        boolean canAllocate(long theSize)
        Returns whether or not the pool can perform an allocation of the given size.
        Parameters:
        theSize - the size of the allocation
        Returns:
        true if the allocation can be performed, false otherwise

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Return whether or not there is any memory left in this pool. Equivalent to memLeft() == 0
        Returns:
        true if the pool is empty, false otherwise

      • memLeft

        long memLeft()
        Return how many bytes remain in this pool
        Returns:
        the amount of memory left in the pool

      • size

        long size()
        Return the total size of the memory pool
        Returns:
        the size of the pool

      • slice

        MemoryPool slice(long theSize)
        Create a child pool of the given size. When the child pool is closed, its resources are returned to this pool and when this pool is closed, its child pools are closed.
        Parameters:
        theSize - the size of the child pool
        Returns:
        the new pool.
